column4: Amgen  Watson to collaborate on cancer biosimilars
column5: DEC 19 - Amgen Inc  the world's largest biotechnology company  and generic drugmaker Watson Pharmaceuticals Inc  said on Monday they will work together to develop and sell biosimilar versions of several biotech cancer drugs.

column4: Apple wins limited ITC ruling in HTC patent case
column5: Taiwanese handset maker HTC Corp narrowly lost a patent battle with Apple Inc on Monday  as the International Trade Commission found that HTC had infringed on one of Apple's patents.

column5: TAIPEI Apple Inc supplier Pegatron Corp's plant in Shanghai was rocked by an explosion over the weekend  the latest in a series of incidents that spotlights safety concerns at factories in China.

column4: REFILE-UPDATE 2-Apple supplier Pegatron hit by China plant blast
column5: TAIPEI  Dec 19 Apple Inc supplier Pegatron Corp reported an explosion at a subsidiary's plant in Shanghai over the weekend that it said had injured 61 workers  the latest in a series of incidents that have spotlighted safety concerns at factories in China.

column4: Samsung expands patent row with Apple in Germany
column5: SEOUL Samsung Electronics has filed new claims in its patent war with Apple Inc over alleged patent infringements in Germany  a spokesman for the company said on Monday.

column5: SEOUL  Dec 19 Samsung Electronics  has filed new claims in its patent war with Apple Inc over alleged patent infringements in Germany  a spokesman for the company said on Monday.

column4: Apple supplier Pegatron says small explosion at Shanghai plant
column5: TAIPEI  Dec 19 Apple Inc supplier Pegatron said a small explosion at its subsidiary in Shanghai  China had injured some workers but would not have a big impact on production.

column5: Dec 19 Shares of Jakks Pacific Inc   which recently snubbed a buyout offer from a private equity fund  slumped 22 percent to their lowest levels in over 16 months  after the toymaker slashed its full-year outlook late on Friday.

column4: Jakks Pacific shares slump on outlook cut
column5: Dec 19 Jakks Pacific Inc's shares slumped to their lowest levels in over 16 months  after the toymaker slashed its full-year outlook late on Friday  citing disappointing sales at the start of the holiday season.

column4: UPDATE 2-Apache bids to control Australia's Burrup Fertilisers

column4: Apache to control of Australia's Burrup Fertilisers
column5: MELBOURNE  Dec 19 U.S. gas producer Apache Corp confirmed on Monday it will buy a 65 percent stake in Burrup Holdings  looking to stabilise the fertiliser business that has been buying gas from its Australian operation.

column4: AT&T drops $39 billion bid to buy T-Mobile USA
column5: AT&T has dropped its controversial $39 billion bid for Deutsche Telekom's wireless U.S. unit  bowing to regulatory opposition over the deal that would have made it the largest cellphone operator in the country.

column5: NEW YORK Talks over potential asset sales as part of AT&T Inc's efforts to get approval of its $39 billion purchase of T-Mobile USA have gone cold  according to The Wall Street Journal on Sunday.

column4: Cathay Pacific delays delivery of 2 Boeing freighters
column5: HONG KONG  Dec 19 Cathay Pacific Airways Ltd said on Monday that it has pushed back delivery of two 747-8F freighters from Boeing Co to 2013  cutting cargo capacity growth to 10 percent next year from an original 17 percent amid weak cargo demand.

column4: Attorneys in Southern Copper case nab $285 million fee
column5: WILMINGTON  Delaware The plaintiffs' attorneys in a shareholder lawsuit involving Southern Copper Corp won a blockbuster $285 million fee award from Delaware's Chancery Court on Monday.

column5: TEL AVIV  Dec 19 Swiss drugmaker Acino Pharma Ltd will acquire the Latin American and Asian businesses of Mepha AG  owned by the Swiss arm of Israel-based Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.

column4: Cablevision  Verizon settle Internet-speed ad suit

column4: UPDATE 1-Bank of Ireland sells Burdale to Wells Fargo
column5: DUBLIN  Dec 19 Bank of Ireland  sold a London-headquartered lending division to U.S. bank Wells Fargo for around 690 million euros on Monday putting it closer to meeting its target of selling 10 billion euros in assets under an EU-IMF bailout.
